title: RM10,000 for info on kidnapped pastor - Nation | The Star Online
text:
PETALING JAYA: The family of abducted pastor Raymond Koh Keng Joo is prepared to offer a reward of up to RM10,000 for information leading to his safe return. 
Koh’s wife, Susanna Liew Sow Yoke, made the offer in a statement yesterday.
“I would like to appeal to those who have taken my husband to return him safe and unharmed,” Liew said. 
This is the first time the family has issued a statement since Koh, 62, went missing on Monday. Those with information are to WhatsApp Koh’s son Jonathan at 011-3973-2670.
Selangor CID chief Senior Asst Comm Fadzil Ahmat confirmed Koh’s abduction on Tuesday.
Liew, 61, believes the people who abducted her husband were “no ordinary abductors”.
“The abductors were masked. The abduction was professionally executed and it took less than 60 seconds (as shown by CCTV footage),” she said.
According to witnesses, at least five masked men were involved. 
Based on a police report by Jonathan, Koh left his Petaling Jaya home at about 10am on Monday.
He was driving a silver Honda Accord bearing the licence plate number ST 5515 D. 
The abduction took place in Jalan SS4b/10, Petaling Jaya, less than 100m from the Police Housing Complex.
According to CCTV footage, at least three black SUVs stopped in the middle of the road.
Koh’s abduction was not properly captured by the camera but the shuffling of feet can be seen, with two SUVs seen moving away, followed by a light-­coloured car believed to be Koh’s. 
The third SUV was seen trailing them. 
Koh was involved in church charity and community work with a group called Harapan Komuniti, which he founded more than 10 years ago. 
Harapan Komuniti holds tuition classes for children and English lessons for adults. 
In 2011, Koh’s NGO was accused by the Selangor Islamic Religious Department (Jais) of preaching to Muslims following a raid on a thanksgiving and fund-raising dinner at the Damansara Utama Methodist Church.
